events.comment:
Initializes extensions and scene variables:
- InitConstants external event defines constant values that are referenced globally in the scene.
Of course, these values are defined as normal scene variables. However, since these values do not change, they are classified as constants.
- InitVariable defines variables that change as the game progresses.
- Passes the layout position information to the extensions.
- Sets the initial score and difficulty.

The "Intro" state that deals with "Intro" layout:
- Displays the Intro layout and switches to the "Home" state after a certain period of time or any input.
- When the state transitions, it destroys the layout by calling CloseIntro external event.

The "Home" state that deals with "Home" layout
- Displays the Home layout and press OK to switch to CountDown state.
- Resets scene variables like score and difficulty that need to be initialized before playing again to default values.
- Reloads the score.

HomeState is the scene variables that contains the substate of the "home" state. It has two substates, "home_created" and "home_handle".
The home_created state means that the Home layout has been created. home_created transitions to the home_handle state to process the inputs.
So home_created can handle things that need to be run only once after the layout is created. All other layouts are handled in the same way.

- When the Play button is pressed, it switches to CountDown state and plays the background music.
- Closes the Home layout

- When the level button is pressed, the level is increased by 5 to 25.
- Resets the score and difficulty by calling the UpdateScoreAndDifficulty external event.

- Clicking the Set button creates a Settings layout.
- Switches to the settings_created state.

- When the Help button is clicked, the Help layout is created.
- Switches to the help_created state

Updates the settings in the settings layout with the values stored in the scene variable Settings.
Simplifies this process with the functions of CommonUtils and SceneUtils extension.
By calling the Settings_HandleKeyInputButton function, a sub-layout is created that can receive key input from the user when the corresponding key button is pressed.
Calls the Settings_HandleVolumeButton function to adjust the sound effect and music volume.

Handles whether to display ghost piece.
If the "Show Ghost Piece" checkbox is checked, it updates the value of the corresponding item in the Settings scene variable.
When the "Reset High Scores" button is pressed, it calls the ResetScore external event to reset the values of the Score scene structure variable.
When the "Reset Settings" button is pressed, it calls the ResetSetting external event to reset the values of the Settings scene structure variables.
When the "Ok" button is pressed, it closes the Settings layout and switches back to the "home_handle" state.

Covers the SettingKeyInput layout.
When a keystroke is received from the user, the corresponding item in the Settings scene variable and the value of the UI control are updated.

Covers the help layout.
When the Ok button is pressed, the Help layout is closed and the state is switched to "home_handle".
The "CountDown" state is changed to "Init" after displaying 3, 2, 1 every 1 second after creating the "CountDown" layout.

Covers the states associated with piece creation.

These states are accompanied by the following tasks:
- Removes the previously created Active / Hold Blocks.
- Updates the next block queue.

"Init" state:
The game starts and the first piece is created.

"Create" state:
The piece is locked during play and is recreated.

"Hold" state:
When the Hold key is pressed, the current piece is stored and a new piece is created with the next one.

"Unhold" state:
When the Hold key is pressed, it is re-created with the previously stored piece.

"Init" state:
The game starts and the first piece is created.

"Create" state:
The piece is locked during play and is recreated.

PieceType scene structure variable:
Set the PieceType variable to the 0th element of the next piece queue.

NextPieceTypes scene structure  variable:
This is a structure variable used to hold the next piece queue.

SetupPiece external event:
The information of the Piece object is updated by calling the SetupPiece external event.
The Piece object is an invisible object. 
It was used to modulate the concept of Piece into behavior.
It deals with the type of piece, the current coordinates on the grid, and information related to the Tetris SRS(Super Rotation System).
https://tetris.wiki/Super_Rotation_System

UpdatNextPieces external event:
It updates the next piece queue by calling the UpdatNextPieces external event.

"Hold" state:
When the Hold key is pressed, the current piece is stored and a new piece is created with the next one.

"Unhold" state:
When the Hold key is pressed, it is re-created with the previously stored piece.

Hold Block:
The Hold block is displayed in the upper left corner of the screen and indicates the piece that has been stored for the next use when the Hold key is pressed.

CanHold variable:
The value 0 of CanHold means that the hold cannot be performed.
It is a variable indicating whether or not the current hold is possible. On the turn in which the Hold or Unhold occurred, you cannot immediately hold or unhold again.
Once a piece is created, you can hold or unhold it.
The CanHold variable is set to 1 after the piece is created by the "Create" state.
The Next block is displayed in the upper right corner of the screen and indicates the piece to be created next time.

Creates an Active piece and a Ghost piece.
Deletes the existing the ghost piece.

Depending on the setting, The ghost piece may not be displayed.

If there are already other blocks in the location where the piece will be created, the game will end.
Delete Ghost Block
New Active Block
Change State To Control
Change State To GameOver
The Control state deals with the manipulation of the piece by user input after the piece is created.

When the Hold key is pressed, it is switched to "Hold" or "Unhold" state by the CanHold and HoldPieceType variables.

HoldPieceType variable:
If not -1, it indicates that the piece is currently being stored.
Change State To Hold
Change State To UnHold
The piece is automatically dropped one line down after the time set in the DropDelay variable has elapsed.
It checks if all active blocks can go down.

If it can go down, update the grid coordinates of the Piece object, and then change the x and y coordinates of the object by adding the local coordinates set for each block to the grid coordinates of the Piece object.

It handles the left and right movement keys.
It uses "InputTimer" and InputDelay variables to handle input not to be processed again for a certain amount of time.
Handles the rotation key. It uses "InputTimer" and InputDelay variables to handle input not to be processed again for a certain amount of time.

The key entered determines the next state of the piece on the SRS.

When rotating clockwise, the state of the piece changes in the order of 0 > R > 2 > L

For more information, please refer to the link below.
https://tetris.wiki/Super_Rotation_System
By SRS, the piece is tested as much as defined in the offset table to see if it can rotate with different offsets. Below is a double loop implementation for this logic.

Handles hard drop where the piece falls to the floor at once.

For more information on drop, please refer to the link below.
https://tetris.wiki/Drop
It finds the floor position where the piece hits and update the grid position of the piece.

If the piece can fall, it updates the grid position of the piece and the x and y positions of the active blocks.
Then it switches to the "Lock" state.
Change State To Lock

Handles soft drop that drops the piece down one line.

For more information on drop, please refer to the link below.
https://tetris.wiki/Drop
The ghost piece is updated with logic similar to hard drop.

Covers the concept of lock delay. 
The lock delay is intended to give the user a chance to manipulate the piece for some time without immediately locking the piece when it hits the floor.

This delay is performed by checking LockTimer timer and LockFrame variable.
This is just my choice to prevent Infinity.

https://tetris.fandom.com/wiki/Infinity
Infinity is The Tetris Company's term (citation needed) to refer to a characteristic in recent Tetris Guideline-compliant games ...

The LockFrame variable increases when the user rotates, or performs soft drop operations.
The LockFrame variable can be increased up to the value of the LockFrameMax variable.

Finally, if the elapsed time of "LockTimer" exceeds LockDelay or LockFrame exceeds LockFrameMax, reset LockFrame to 0.
Then it switches to "Lock" state.
Change State To Lock

Handles the condition when the piece hits the floor.

It destroys active blocks and creates locked blocks in the same place.
Then it sets that the cell is occupied through the Grid object.

Scores are also processed at this phase.
Update "Score"
The score increases when the piece hits the floor.

It checks if there are any filled lines in the grid.
If filled, set the status of the locked blocks occupying that line to "Clear" for the falling animation.
Update "Lines"
It gets the total number of filled lines and sets it to the LinesText text object.
If there is a filled line, the Score and Level are also updated.
Update Score
Update Level

Line variable:
The number of filled lines is accumulated in the Lines variable.

LinesForCurrentLevel variable:
The LinesForCurrentLevel variable accumulates the number of lines increased from the current level.
And when it exceeds LinesToIncreaseLevel, it increases the Level variable.
This logic is required because users can adjust the starting level of the Home layout.
Change State To PreCrate Or Clear

If there are filled lines, the locked blocks that occupy those lines flash.
Then, it switches to the Clear state.
Flashing
Change State To Clear
If there are no filled lines, it switches to the PreCreate state.
Change State To PreCreate
The "PreCreate" state is for implementing entry delay.
If this state is transitioned by hard drop, it goes directly to the "Create" state.

If this state is not transitioned by hard drop, it handles entry delay.
The entry delay is to give a little delay before creating the piece.
This delay becomes shorter as the level increases.
Change State To Create
The "Clear" state removes the locked blocks in the filled line and drops the blocks above it.
The distance a block will fall is the number of blank lines below the block.

The FallToFloor function in TetrisBlock behavior starts an animation that falls down.
And it turns the state of the falling blocks into "Falling".
If there are no falling blocks, it switches to "PreCreate" state.
Change State To PreCreate
If there are falling blocks, It starts the "Falling Timer" and switches to "Falling" state.
Change State To Falling

The "Falling" state ends the falling animation.
And it adjusts the difference between the distance moved by the animation and the coordinates that should be placed on the actual grid.
Change State To PreCreate
The "GameOver" state displays a list of scores and switches to the "Home" state.

It loads score.json by calling the LoadScore external event.
score.json keeps the top 5 score list.
It checks if one of the top 5 scores has been exceeded.
If the high score has been updated, create the NewHighScore layout.

If Ok is clicked, the excess high score is updated with a new one.
Scores below that are updated to the next score.
The SaveScore external event saves the Scores structure variable to score.json.
Clicking Ok closes the GameOver layout and puts it in the "Home" state.
Common
Layout
Score
Setting
These values are reset every time the game is restarted.
The high score list is updated with the values set in the scene structure variable Scores.
Destroys the objects used for the NewHighScore layout.
Destroys the objects used for the Intro layout.
Destroys the objects used for the Home layout.
Destroys the objects used for the CountDown layout.
Destroys the objects used for the GameOver layout.
When the block is locked, the score increases according to the last action.
As the line fills, the score is incrementally increased according to the value defined in the ScorePerLines variable.

Adjust the delay timing according to the level to increase the difficulty.
The square root function is used for smooth change in difficulty.
Destroys sprite objects created in the scene and initializes text information.
Set up the type of piece and center the initial position.
Destroys the objects used for the Help layout.
Destroys the objects used for the Settings layout.
Updates the next queue.
Destroys the objects used for the SettingsKeyInput layout.
Loads the score.json file into the Scores scene variable.
Saves the Scores scene variable to the score.json file.
Resets the Scores scene variable.
Updates the location of the ghost piece.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The sound effect is played by referring to the value stored in the SoundFxVolume in the Settings scene variable.
The background music is played by referring to the value stored in the MusicVolume in the Settings scene variable.
Stops playing the background music.
Uses Block_PutLockedOnes API to check if the T-Spin skill works properly.
Uses Block_PutLockedOnes API to check if the T-Spin skill works properly.
It takes the game name as an argument and creates a directory under the user data path.
Outputs a string to the console area of Developer Tools for debugging.
Outputs a string in the form of name: value in the console area of Developer Tools for debugging.
Outputs a string in the form of name: value in the console area of Developer Tools for debugging.
Outputs a string in the form of name: value in the console area of Developer Tools for debugging.
Outputs a string in the form of name: value in the console area of Developer Tools for debugging.
Outputs a scene variable in the console area of Developer Tools for debugging.
Returns the game data path that was set by the Initialize function.
Add thousand separators to a string of numbers.
Aligns the object to the right based on the given anchor position.
Aligns the object to the center based on the given anchor position.
Set the text and aligns the object to the right based on the given anchor position.
Sets the text and aligns the object to the center based on the given anchor position.
Initializes the variables referenced in the TetrisUtils extension.
Tetromino information is set.
Set the start position of grid, next queue, hold queue. So if these locations change, other codes in the extension are not affected.
Returns the pixel size of a block.
Returns the name of the piece corresponding to the given type.

Returns the SRS Type of the piece corresponding to the given type.

0 stands for J, L, S, T and Z pieces.
I stands for I piece.
Returns the number of the blocks int the piece corresponding to the given type.
Returns the size of the piece corresponding to the given type.
Returns the local x position of the block in the piece corresponding to the given type and index.
Returns the local y position of the block in the piece corresponding to the given type and index.

Returns the preview x offset of the piece corresponding to the given type.

This value is used in the Hold Queue and Next Queue to ensure that the piece is centered vertically.

Returns the preview y offset of the piece corresponding to the given type.

This value is used in the Hold Queue and Next Queue to ensure that the piece is centered vertically.
Puts the block in the given location.
Put blocks set as strings at the given grid y location.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: This is the behavior that handles movement and rotation of blocks within a piece.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TetrisBlock

events.comment: Initializes variables used internally by the block object.
Set the local coordinates of the block by referring to the scene Pieces structure variable.
Update the position on the next queue.
Update the position on the Hold.
The pixel position is updated based on the grid positions of the piece.
Checks if the block's position is in an already occupied grid cell.
Checks if the block can be moved to the left.
Check if the block can be moved to the right.
Check if the block can be moved to the down.
Check if the block can be moved to the down by the y offset.
Checks if the block can rotate.

The rotation of the block about its local coordinates follows the rotation method in the document below.
https://tech.migge.io/2017/02/07/tetris-rotations/
Moves the block to the left by the size of the grid cell.
Moves the block to the right by the size of the grid cell.
Converts the current pixel position to the grid position.
Converts the current pixel position to the grid position.
Drops the block down at the distance and speed given as arguments.
Adjusts the blocks that fall down to their actual grid position.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: This is the behavior that handles the cell data in the grid.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TetrisGrid

events.comment: Initializes the scene structure variable _Grid to have rows and columns.
Sets the cell value of the given grid location to 0.
Returns whether the given grid position is empty.
Initializes all cells in the grid to zero.
Returns how full the cells in the given row are.
Sets the cell at the given grid position to be filled.
Fills the cell corresponding to the location of the block given as an argument.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: This is the behavior object that handles the movement and rotation of the piece.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TetrisPiece

events.comment: Initializes variables used internally by the piece object.

[Direction]: ClockWise(1) or CounterClockWise(-1)
[Direction][CurrentState]: The current SRS state, one of "0", "R", "2", "L"
[Direction][CurrentState][NextSate]: The next SRS state in the direction

For more information, please refer to the link below.
https://tetris.wiki/Super_Rotation_System

Set the test offset values of Super Rotation System.

For more information, please refer to the link below.
https://tetris.wiki/Super_Rotation_System

0 ->R

A fifth offset was added to correct the problem that the I piece cannot rotate when it touches the floor in the 0 state.
Sets the type of piece and information related to that type as object variables.
Returns the name of piece.
Returns the size of piece.
Returns the number of blocks that make up piece.
Adjust the piece so that it is centered horizontally when it is created.
Move piece's grid coordinates 1 to the left.
Move piece's grid coordinates 1 to the right.
Move piece's grid coordinates 1 to the down.
Move piece's grid coordinates 1 to the down by the given y offset.
Move piece's grid coordinates by the given offsets
Transitions the SRS state to the next state.
Returns the grid x coordinate of the piece.
Returns the grid y coordinate of the piece.
Returns the SRS x offset according to the given rotation direction and test count.

parameters: "OffsetX _SrsType: " + Object.VariableString(_SrsType) + " _SrsState: " + Object.VariableString(_SrsState) + " _NextState: " + Object.VariableString(_NextState) + " test: " + GetArgumentAsString("test") + " value: " + Object.VariableString(_SRS[Object.VariableString(_SrsType)][Object.VariableString(_SrsState)][Object.VariableString(_NextState)][GetArgumentAsString("test")]["x"])

events.comment: Returns the SRS y offset according to the given rotation direction and test count.

parameters: "OffsetY _SrsType: " + Object.VariableString(_SrsType) + " _SrsState: " + Object.VariableString(_SrsState) + " _NextState: " + Object.VariableString(_NextState) + " test: " + GetArgumentAsString("test") + " value: " + Object.VariableString(_SRS[Object.VariableString(_SrsType)][Object.VariableString(_SrsState)][Object.VariableString(_NextState)][GetArgumentAsString("test")]["y"])

events.comment: Sets whether the piece has been moved or rotated.
Resets that the piece has been moved or rotated.
Returns whether the piece has been moved or rotated.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: This is the behavior object that handles delayed input.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TetrisDelayedInputHandler

events.comment: Initializes variables used internally
Set the delay time between inputs.
Resets the timer and internal variables.
Checks if an input occurred after the delay time.
Checks if an input occurred after the delay time for two keys.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

events.comment: Set the referenced positions of the scene as internally referenced variables. So if these locations change, other codes in the extension are not affected.
Create a layout to receive keystrokes and set the key name in that layout to the given name argument value.
Changes the text of the key button and center it horizontally.

Returns whether the checkbox was pressed.

Returns the checked state
Changes the checked state of the checkbox.
Handles input events for the checkbox.
Returns whether the button was pressed.
Resets the pressed state
